definition: meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
hand-held mutton (mutton pieces on the bone, eaten with the fingers)

sentences.english: But I have a headache at the thought of eating mutton.
sentences.chinese: 可我一想到涮羊肉就有點頭疼。

sentences.english: The herdsmen like to eat beef , mutton and dairy products, and drink black tea and brick tea .
sentences.chinese: 牧民們喜歡喫牛羊肉和奶製品，喜歡喝紅茶和磚茶。

sentences.english: Fried mutton fat with onions goes well with vodka.
sentences.chinese: 油炸肥羊肉伴洋蔥，再加上一杯伏特加就是絕配了。

sentences.english: Mutton and eggs are the major sacrifices offered to the God of Rivers.
sentences.chinese: 羊肉和蛋是給河神的主要祭品。
那些羊肉都是多脂肪的。

sentences.english: We had lamb chops and potatoes for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我們晚餐喫羊肉片和馬鈴薯。

sentences.english: How do you think the instant-boiled mutton?
sentences.chinese: 咱們去喫涮羊肉，你們意下如何？

sentences.english: The butcher sold bill a pound of lamb.
sentences.chinese: 那個賣肉的賣給比爾一磅羊肉。

sentences.english: No, but I have beef and mutton.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，但有牛肉和羊肉餡的。

sentences.english: Roast lamb anchors most Greek holiday meals. Special sweet breads are made at Christmas and Easter.
sentences.chinese: 烤羊肉是大多數希臘人的節日佳餚。

sentences.english: The invention provides a mutton tenderizing agent.
sentences.chinese: 本發明提供了一種羊肉嫩化劑。

sentences.english: Lamb and mutton are popular meats in many regions of the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 中東許多地區的人們都愛喫羊羔肉和羊肉。

sentences.english: Cumin lamb kebabs, oily but fun.
sentences.chinese: 烤羊肉串，油油的但挺有趣。

sentences.english: And what meat will you have? The mutton is very good, and so is the roast veal.
sentences.chinese: 你要什麼肉？這裏羊肉非常好，烤的小牛肉也不錯。

sentences.english: M: Yes, we do. We also eat mutton.
Young boys in plastic sandals called out in high, hoarse voices, selling skewers of goat meat.
sentences.chinese: 穿着塑料拖鞋的男孩們用粗啞的聲音高聲叫賣羊肉串。

definition: pork chop/pork cutlet/spare ribs/(coll.) skinny person
a flock of sheep (or goats)/old variant of 膻[shan1]/old variant of 羶[shan1]
